CABINET.THE MEAT SITUATION.THE CATTLE INDUSTRY (EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE) BILL.Note by the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries covering draft Bill.I am circulating, for the information of the Cabinet, a draft of a Bill embodying the emergency proposals to deal with the Beef situation as promised in the Memorandum by the Lord President of the Council (CP. 182 (34)).(Intd.) W.E.Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries. July 10th, 1934. Cattle Industry (Emergency Assistance).ARRANGEMENT OF CLAUSES.Clause.1. Establishment of, and payments to, Cattle Fund. 2. Payments out of Cattle Fund to producers of cattle. 3. The Cattle Fund. 4. Marking of imported cattle. 5. Interpretation. 6. Short title.172-2A [24 & 25 Gbo. 5] Cattle Industry(Emergency Assistance).DRAFTof aBILLtoProvide for the establisliment of a Cattle Fund; a.d. 1934. for the making of payments and advances to the said fund out of moneys provided by Par-liament and out of the Consolidated Fund of the United Kingdom; for making payments out of the Cattle Fund to producers of cattle in respect of the sale by them, during a limited period, of cattle or carcases of cattle; and for purposes connected with the matters aforesaid.BE it enacted by the King's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, 5 as follows : 1. (1) For the purposes of this Act there shall be Establish-established a fund (which shall be called, and is herein- merit of, after referred to as, " the Cattle Fund"), and that and Pay-fund shall, subject to such directions as may be given Q^ttleFund 10 by the Treasury, be administered and controlled by the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries and the Secretaries of State concerned with Agriculture in Scotland and Northern Ireland respectively (hereinafter referred to as " the appropriate Ministers ").15 (2) There shall be paid into the Cattle Fund out of moneys provided by Parliament such sums as Parliament may determine.172-2 A 2 A.D. 1934.Payments out of Cattle Fund to producers of cattle.2 Cattle Industry [24 & 25 Geo. 5.](Emergency Assistance).(3) The Treasury may make, out of the Consolidated Fund of the United Kingdom or the growing produce thereof, advances to the Cattle Fund not exceeding in the aggregate three million pounds, but the amount of any advances made under this subsection shall be repaid 5 out of moneys provided by Parliament before the end of March, nineteen hundred and thirty-five.(4) Before the beginning of October, nineteen hundred and thirty-five, the appropriate Ministers shall prepare, in such form and in such manner as the 10 Treasury may direct, an account showing the revenue and expenditure of the Cattle Fund attributable to the period between the commencement of this Act and the end of March, nineteen hundred and thirty-five, and the Comptroller and Auditor General shall examine and 15 certify the account and shall lay copies thereof, together with his report thereon, before both Houses of Parliament.2. (1) The appropriate Ministers may apply the moneys of the Cattle Fund in making, in accordance with arrangements approved by them for the purposes 20 of this section, payments to producers of cattle in respect of the sale by them, at specified places within the United Kingdom, of cattle, or the carcases of cattle, which, at the time of sale or slaughter, as the case may be, conformed with the standard prescribed by regulations 25 of the said Ministers as indicating the fitness of the cattle to be slaughtered for food for human consumption :Provided that no payment shall be made under this subsection in respect of any sale of cattle or carcases effected after the end of March, nineteen hundred and 30 thirty-five, nor in respect of any sale of imported cattle effected within three months from the date on which they were entered for home consumption or home use, and every payment under this subsection shall (a) in the case of the sale of any five animal, be 35made at such rate, not exceeding five shillings for every hundredweight of the weight of the animal at the time of the sale, as may be specified in an order made by the appropriate Ministers, after consultation with the Treasury; 40 or(b) in the case of the sale of any carcase, be madeat such rate, not exceeding nine shillings and [24 & 25 Geo; 5.] Cattle Industry . 3[Emergency Assistance).fourpence for every hundredweight of the weight A.D. 1934 of the carcase at the time of the sale, as may be so specified.(2) As soon as may be after they have approved 5 any arrangements for the purposes of this section, the appropriate Ministers shall lay particulars of the arrangements before each House of Parliament.3. (1) The appropriate Ministers shall appoint a The Cattle Committee (hereinafter referred to as " the Cattle Com- Committee.10 mittee"), whose duty it shall be to advise those Ministers generally in the discharge of their functions under this Act, and in particular to prepare and submit to those Ministers for their approval such arrangements as are mentioned in the last foregoing section and, if15 those Ministers so direct, to carry into effect any such arrangements approved by them.(2) The appropriate Ministers may appoint a secretary to the Cattle Committee, and the Committee may employ such officers, agents and servants as the 20 those Ministers, with the approval of the Treasury, may determine.(3) The appropriate Ministers may pay such remunerative-ation to the members of the Cattle Committee and to the secretary, officers, agents and servants of the 25 Committee, and such other expenses of the Committee, as those Ministers may, with the approval of the Treasury, determine.(4) The expenses incurred by the appropriate Ministers in pursuance of the last foregoing subsection 30 shall in the first instance oe defrayed out of moneys provided by Parliament, but the amount of those ex-penses, as certified by the Treasury, shall, at such time as the Treasury may direct, be paid out of the Cattle Fund into the Exchequer of the United Kingdom.35 4. (1) With a view to ensuring the due making of Marking of payments to producers of cattle in accordance with this imported Act, the appropriate Ministers may make an order for cattle-securing that no cattle imported into the United Kingdom which, while the order is in force, are entered for home40 consumption or home use, shall leave the port of entry until they have been marked in such manner as may be prescribed by the order, and the order may contain such Cattle Industry [24 & 25 Geo. 5.] (Emergency Assistance).A.D. 1934. further provisions as appear to the appropriate Ministers to be necessary or expedient for giving effect to the order :Provided that an order under this section shall not apply in relation to any imported cattle which are entered, after the end of March, nineteen hundred and 5 thirty-five, for home consumption or home use.(2) If any person (a) contravenes or fails to comply with any order under this section; or (6) with intent to deceive, alters or defaces any 10mark placed on any animal for the purposes ofsuch an order;he shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding twenty pounds or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding three months or to both such fine and such 15 imprisonment.Interpre- 5. (1) For the purposes of this Act tatl0n- (a) the expression " cattle " means steers, heifersor cow-heifers; and(6) a person shall be taken to be a producer of 20 cattle if he is a person whose business it is to keep cattle in the United Kingdom for the purpose of selling them in an improved condition.(2) The power to make an order under any of the 25 provisions of this Act shall be construed as including a power, exercisable in the like manner and subject to the like restrictions, if any, to vary or revoke the order by a subsequent order.Short title, 6.
